result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph T. Beale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  Jail to commence on or before May 20, 2017. Provide DNA Sample.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph T. Beale in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Rick C. Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court. JB's mother makes statement. Victim makes statement.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Counts 1 & 2: Dismissed but read in

Count 3:
$453.00 costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
6 mos. in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  Commence on or before May 20, 2017 @ 6PM
EMP authorized
Restitution in this case to be paid as a condition of probation in 15CF382 and 15CF320
Provide DNA Sample
Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 21, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on March 15, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Tsai states DE on the intake basis for drug court.  Just found out yesterday that didn't happen. Team ran out of time to discuss.  State requests warrant, todays date was set for DE to appear.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant but stay 2 weeks.  Return date scheduled for March 15, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on February 21, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tsai gives status.  Defendant not required to appear today.  Matters are resolved, however assessments need to be finished.  Request short reset/status in 45 days.  State request less time and return for mandatory appearance.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for February 21, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on August 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Telephone conference on July 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph T. Beale in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai states status.  Believes matter will all be resolved.  DE is being referred to drug court.  Requests any JT's be taken off the calendar.  Court will not do that yet.  State has no knowledge of DE's status as to drug court but there has been no notice provided for JT as of yet.  State also believed matters would be resolved.  State suggests all matters be set for status conference early one morning on all three matters about 2 weeks down the road so Atty Tsai can inform the Court as to the drug court status.  Court resets.  JT's are cancelled.  Bonds continued in all matters.  Telephone conference scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Telephone conference scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on June 21, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Final pre-trial at 06-20-2016 01:00 pm
Jury trial at 06-30-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Joseph T. Beale in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'Rourke acknowledges rec. information/waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters NG pleas.  Bond continued.
Arraignment at 01-14-2016 01:00 pm

Defendant Joseph T. Beale in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney ORourke advises of waiver.  Defendant agrees with waiver.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.  Argn. date to be set out.  Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Return date at 12-17-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Joseph Beale in court with attorney Deb ORourke.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney ORourke advises awaiting further police reports.  Matter reset. Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 11-13-2015 09:00 am.
Return date at 11-24-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph T. Beale in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived.  $2000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today and submit to DNA sample.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
